TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DynamicDocumentPaginator extends System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator
Public MustInherit Class DynamicDocumentPaginator Inherits DocumentPaginator

summary.span: 提供抽象基类，该抽象基类除了支持其自己基类的方法和属性之外，还支持自动后台分页和在重新分页期间跟踪内容位置。

span.span: Provides an abstract base class that supports automatic background pagination and tracking content positions across repaginations in addition to the methods and properties of its own base class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下自动预先的分页也会在后台中的内容 (此过程时，开始是`true`，这是默认设置)。By default, a will automatically pre-paginate content in the background (this process begins when is `true`, which is the default setting). 当是`true`，也将由于内容更改或中的更改而重新分页布局。When is `true`, the layout will also be repaginated due to changes in content or changes in . 事件发生的分页 （或进行重新分页） 的一个或多个页面，完成后此类在以下情况：The event occurs upon completion of pagination (or repagination) of one or more pages, such as in the following situations: - 因为在后台对内容进行分页，则会发生事件。 events occur as content is paginated in the background. 具体取决于实现，该事件时，可能出现对一个或多个页进行分页 (指定已分页的页)。Depending on the implementation, the event may occur upon paginating one or multiple pages ( specifies which pages have been paginated). - 调用或可能会导致事件发生后如果不具有已指定的页进行分页。Calls to or may cause an event to occur if the page specified has not been paginated. 例如，如果已启用后台分页 ( = `true`)，但分页仅已完成到第三个页上，调用的带有 6 参数将导致页四个、 五个、 第六和七个存储帐户来进行分页。For example, if background pagination is enabled ( = `true`) but pagination has only been completed up to the third page, a call of with an argument of 6 will cause pages four, five, six, and seven to be paginated. 完成后，将与引发事件的设置= 4 和= 4。Upon completion, a event will be raised with settings of = 4 and = 4. - 启用后台分页 ( = `true`)，在更改流格式的内容，如、 可能会导致重新分页和关联的事件。With background pagination enabled ( = `true`), a change in on flow-format content, such as a , may cause repagination and associated events. 请注意，不起作用中进行重新分页固定格式的内容，如、 visual 页大小不影响布局。Note that has no effect in repagination on fixed-format content, such as , where the visual page size does not affect the layout. 一个后台分页处于禁用状态时，也会发生事件。A event also occurs when background pagination is disabled. 例如，如果只有一页的内容和 = `false`)，则调用参数为 0 将导致两个事件：For example, if there is only one page of content and = `false`), calling with an argument of 0 will result in two events: 1. 一个具有事件的设置= 0 和= 1。A event with settings of = 0 and = 1. 2. 一个事件。A event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果前的页`contentPosition`尚未格式化，他们将进行分页以同步方式返回请求的页面数目之前。If pages prior to the `contentPosition` have not been formatted, they will be paginated synchronously prior to returning the requested page number. 提供的类似功能与，但与异步操作。 provides similar functionality as , but with asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要取消此方法的异步操作的唯一方法是取消所有异步操作。The only way to cancel the asynchronous operation of this method is to cancel all asynchronous operations. 此方法的其他重载与之相比，： 。Contrast this with the other overload of this method: . 此方法将引发事件。This method raises the event. 页码作为事件自变量之一传递给该事件。The page number is passed to the event as one of the event arguments. 请参阅有关如何使用此方法获取的页码。See for how to use this method to get the page number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的重载，使可能取消此异步操作，如果不取消所有异步操作。This overload of the method makes it possible to cancel this asynchronous operation without cancelling all asynchronous operations. 此方法将引发事件。This method raises the event. 以下步骤演示了如何检索的页码给定`contentPosition`以异步方式。The following steps illustrate how to retrieve the page number of a given `contentPosition` asynchronously. 1. 创建委托并将其接收的通知添加事件。Create a delegate and add it to be notified of events. 2. 调用指定`contentPosition`所需的唯一`userState`将用于标识异步任务的对象。Call specifying the `contentPosition` desired and a unique `userState` object that will be used to identify the asynchronous task. 3. 当发生此事件并调用该委托时，比较事件的。When the event occurs and the delegate is called, compare the event's . 属性与原始`userState`参数。property with the original `userState` parameter. 4. 当。When the . 属性与匹配原始 `userState`、 操作已完成和页码已准备就绪。property matches the original `userState`, the operation is complete and the page number is ready. ( 。(The . 属性也会匹配原始`contentPosition`参数。)property will also match the original `contentPosition` parameter.) 5. .The . 属性包含指定的从零开始的页码`contentPosition`。property contains the zero-based page number of the specified `contentPosition`. 提供的类似功能与，但为同步操作。 provides similar functionality as , but for synchronous operation.

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否在后台自动执行分页，以响应某些事件（如页大小的更改）。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether pagination is performed automatically in the background in response to certain events, such as a change in page size.

value.span: 如果已启用后台分页，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if background pagination is enabled; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当`true`，在后台执行分页，引发和作为相应的事件。When `true`, pagination is performed in the background, raising and events as appropriate. 分页内容，为不同于到视觉对象的更改不影响。Pagination of content, as distinct from a is not affected by changes to the visual .

summary.span: 当已对所有文档内容进行分页时发生。

span.span: Occurs when all document content has been paginated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当发生，是`true`直到启动新的分页。When occurs, is `true` until a new pagination is initiated.
